subject: Travel
title: The Workforce Behind the Pyramids
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Workforce Behind the Pyramids.

hook.text: For centuries, people believed slaves built the pyramids. Hollywood made this the standard story.

buildup.text: In 2010, archaeologists found tombs of pyramid workers buried with honor near the site.

discovery.text: The builders were paid laborers. Records show they received bread, beer, and medical care.

twist.text: Some workers left graffiti on blocks, naming their crews things like 'Friends of Khufu.'

climax.text: About 20,000 workers rotated in shifts, living in a purpose-built village nearby.

punchline.text: The pyramids were built by proud workers, not slaves.

quiz.question: What evidence showed pyramid builders were paid laborers?
options: Honorable tombs found near the site
